Treatment of recurrent basal cell carcinoma is usually Mohs micrographic surgery.   Treatment of basal cell carcinoma that is metastatic or cannot be treated with local therapy may include the following:         -  Targeted therapy with a signal transduction inhibitor.    -  Chemotherapy.    - A clinical trial of a new treatment.
